intro: Lacistema hasslerianum, commonly known as the silverleaf lacistema, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
